duties_responsibilities.duty: Develop and execute a comprehensive sales and marketing plan to significantly increase business in pre-owned semiconductor equipment, spare parts, and Thin Film Wafers.
Work closely with product managers to exceed sales goals and develop sustainable new businesses.
Provide knowledge and insight to internal systems for data integrity and real-time sharing with global teams.
Participate in global weekly meetings to share deal opportunities/progress and market trends.
Ensure accurate forecasting of buys and sells on a monthly and quarterly basis.
Identify and acquire new customers while strengthening partnerships with End users, OEMs, and 3rd parties.
Conduct onsite/virtual inspection, valuation, negotiation, purchasing, and logistics processes.
Support and launch tool refurbishment and installation at customers’ field aligned with HQ.
Plan and coordinate product demos, customer visits, and customer meetings involving division personnel.
Foster relationships at all levels internally and externally and prepare for industry exhibitions.
Build relationships with internal stakeholder teams and understand differentiated strategies and roadmap.
Develop and build relationships with customers’ teams to understand their technology needs and application requirements.
Deeply involve in demand and supply management, and logistics.
Travel more than 30% of the time.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Management, Engineering, or a related field
